Name: Alexander
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: Son of Babar and Celeste

Name: Arthur
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: Cousin of Babar

Name: Babar
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: An elephant prince

Name: Berilia
Author: Terry Pratchett
Notes: One of the four elephants who carry the Discworld whilst standing on the shell of Great A'Tuin the Turtle

Name: Celeste
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: Female cousin of Babar , with whom she eventually marries

Name: Chota
Author: Elif Åžafak
Notes: A gift to the Sultan , this very white elephant dwells in the royal menagerie when not used on construction sites . ( Also mentioned are Chota 's mother Pakeeza , his mate Gulbahar , his son Panj , and Mahmood , an African bush elephant who is Chota 's rival for status . )

Name: Cornelius
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: Counsellor of king Babar

Name: The Elephant Child
Author: Rudyard Kipling
Notes: In How the Elephant Got His Trunk

Name: Ella
Author: Carmela D ' Amico and Steven D ' Amico
Notes: A jolly young elephant who wears a big red hat and a blue criss-cross dress

Name: Elmer
Author: David McKee
Notes: Character of children 's story books

Name: Flora
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: Daughter of Babar and Celeste

Name: Great T'Phon
Author: Terry Pratchett
Notes: One of the four elephants who carry the Discworld whilst standing on the shell of Great A'Tuin the Turtle

Name: Hathi
Author: Rudyard Kipling
Notes: Head of the jungle elephant troop ; featured in several adventures with the boy , Mowgli

Name: Horton
Author: Dr. Seuss
Notes: A fictional character from the books Horton Hatches the Egg and Horton Hears a Who ! , both by Dr. Seuss . Horton is a kind , sweet-natured elephant who cares about other animals or people

Name: Icebones
Author: Stephen Baxter
Notes: Major character in the novel

Name: Isabelle
Author: Jean de Brunhoff
Notes: Daughter of Babar and Celeste

Name: Jerakeen
Author: Terry Pratchett
Notes: One of the four elephants who carry the Discworld whilst standing on the shell of Great A'Tuin the Turtle

Name: Jumbo ( given name )
Author: Mark Twain
Notes: White elephant 's actual name : Hassan Ben Ali Ben Selim Abdallah Mohammed Moist Alhammal Jamsetjejeebhoy Dhuleep Sultan Ebu Bhudpoor

Name: Kabumpo
Author: Ruth Thompson
Notes: Also known as the Elegant Elephant of Pumperdink he was originally a christening gift to the king of Pumperdink , Pompus

Name: Kala Nag
Author: Rudyard Kipling
Notes: In Toomai of the Elephants ( Kala Nag means Black Snake )
